column1: The site is first cleaned with germ-killing medicine (antiseptic).
Some medicines can affect the test results.
This test is most often done to find out whether a growth hormone deficiency (GH deficiency) is causing slowed growth.

Other risks associated with having blood drawn are slight, but may include: - Excessive bleeding - Fainting or feeling lightheaded - Hematoma (blood accumulating under the skin) - Infection (a slight risk any time the skin is broken) Medicines that stimulate the pituitary during the test may cause side effects.
